verses.text: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
For the transgression of a land many \add are\add* its princes: but by a man of understanding \add and\add* knowledge the state \add thereof\add* shall be prolonged.
A poor man that oppresseth the poor \add is like\add* a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.
Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all \add things\add* .
Better \add is\add* the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than \add he that is\add* perverse \add in his\add* ways, though he \add is\add* rich.
He who keepeth the law \add is\add* a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous \add men\add* shameth his father.
He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer \add shall be\add* abomination.
Whoever causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good \add things\add* in possession.
The rich man \add is\add* wise in his own conceit; but the poor man that hath understanding searcheth him out.
When righteous \add men\add* rejoice, \add there is\add* great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but he who confesseth and forsaketh \add them\add* shall have mercy.
Happy \add is\add* the man that feareth always: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
\add As\add* a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; \add so is\add* a wicked ruler over the poor people.
The prince that wanteth understanding \add is\add* also a great oppressor: \add but\add* he that hateth covetousness shall prolong \add his\add* days.
A man that doeth violence to the blood of \add any\add* person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
He who walketh uprightly shall be saved: but \add he that is\add* perverse \add in his\add* ways shall fall at once.
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain \add persons\add* shall have poverty enough.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
To have respect of persons \add is\add* not good: for, for a piece of bread \add that\add* man will transgress.
He that hasteth to be rich \add hath\add* an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.
He that rebuketh a man afterward shall find more favor than he that flattereth with the tongue.
He that robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, \add It is\add* no transgression; the same \add is\add* the companion of a destroyer.
He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.
He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoever walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
He that giveth to the poor shall not want: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
